abstract: Federal appeals court in Manhattan orders a new trial for Mahmoud Reza Banki, tossing out his conviction for violating the Iran trade embargo and finding that he deserves a second chance to show he was not part of an unlicensed money transfer business.
snippet: An appeals court ruling brings a measure of redemption for Mahmoud Reza Banki, who has been serving a two-and-a-half-year sentence.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court ruling brings a measure of redemption for Mahmoud Reza Banki, who has been serving a two-and-a-half-year sentence.

headline.main: New Trial for Man Accused of Violating Iran Embargo
headline.print_headline: New Trial for Man Accused Of Violating Iran Embargo
headline.seo: Man Accused of Violating Iran Trade Embargo Will Get New Trial
